When I shut down Firefox I see a brief flash of the previous site I was visiting.
For example :
1st screen : www.schmalspurbahn.ch
then I change to www.yahoo.com and then shut down, when the Yahoo screen disappears, there is a brief flash of the schmalspurbahn screen as though it had been behind the yahoo screen, but it is not a whole Firefox screen it is only the main picture that had been on the page.
See the picture in this link : http://webcam.schmalspurbahn.ch/filisur/webcam/
Its happened only since the latest update.


Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. display a page with a picture embedded
2. go to another site
3. shut down Firefox

Actual Results:  
as per the write up, see a quick flash of the picture from step one

Expected Results:  
Firefox should have just shut down, the 'flash' shouldn't have happened
comments.author: bubb.flavel@googlemail.com

I've just gone to this site :
http://uk.weather.com/mapRoom/mapRoom?locID=UKXX0124&locType=1&lat=49.67&lon=-2.17&from=today&lev=10&type=sat&title=Local%20Aerial%20View

And the first thing that appeared in the map screen section when I changed from :
http://uk.weather.com/weather/today-Saint-Anne/Alderney-Island-UKXX0124?fromSearch=true
by clicking on the 'local area view'
was a flash of : page 65 of : http://www.haribu.ch/RhB.pdf
Which was the previous site I was at, also, when I went back to the second site, the Alderney map appeared for about 1 second over the top of the second site. This has occurred without shutting down Firefox.
